cves.description: A flaw was found in Red Hat Openshift AI Service. A low-privileged attacker with access to an authenticated account, for example as a data scientist using a standard Jupyter notebook, can escalate their privileges to a full cluster administrator. This allows for the complete compromise of the cluster's confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The attacker can steal sensitive data, disrupt all services, and take control of the underlying infrastructure, leading to a total breach of the platform and all applications hosted on it.

NVIDIA Delegated Licensing Service for all appliance platforms contains a vulnerability where an User/Attacker may cause an authorized action. A successful exploit of this vulnerability may lead to information disclosure.

affected.product: DLS component of NVIDIA License System

versions.version: All versions prior to v3.5.1 and v3.1.7

problemType: CWE-306 Missing Authentication for Critical Function

cves.description: NVIDIA Delegated Licensing Service for all appliance platforms contains a SQL injection vulnerability where an User/Attacker may cause an authorized action. A successful exploit of this vulnerability may lead to partial denial of service (UI component).

affected.product: DLS component of NVIDIA License System

versions.version: All versions prior to v3.5.1 and v3.1.7

problemType: CWE-943 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Data Query Logic

cves.description: Rapid7 AppSpider Pro versions below 7.5.021 suffer from a project name validation vulnerability, whereby an attacker can change the project name directly in the configuration file to a name that already exists. This issue stems from a lack of effective verification of the uniqueness of project names when editing them outside the application in affected versions. This vulnerability was remediated in version 7.5.021 of the product.
problemType: CWE-345 Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity

cves.description: NVIDIA Delegated Licensing Service for all appliance platforms contains a vulnerability where an User/Attacker may cause an authorized action. A successful exploit of this vulnerability may lead to information disclosure.

affected.product: DLS component of NVIDIA License System

versions.version: All versions prior to v3.5.1 and v3.1.7

problemType: CWE-312 Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information

cves.description: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability with audit events in Liferay Portal 7.4.0 through 7.4.3.117, and older unsupported versions, and Liferay DXP 2024.Q1.1 through 2024.Q1.5, 2023.Q4.0 through 2023.Q4.10, 2023.Q3.1 through 2023.Q3.10, 7.4 GA through update 92, and older unsupported versions allows remote authenticated users to from one virtual instance to view the audit events from a different virtual instance via the _com_liferay_portal_security_audit_web_portlet_AuditPortlet_auditEventId parameter.
problemType: CWE-639 Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
